org.dgfoundation.amp.ar.viewfetcher

Class DatabaseViewFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.ar.viewfetcher.DatabaseViewFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ViewFetcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    I18nDatabaseViewFetcher, RawDatabaseViewFetcher

    public abstract class DatabaseViewFetcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements ViewFetcher
    a ViewFetcher for fetching data from a real database, either with or without postprocessing

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • connection

        protected final java.sql.Connection connection

      • viewName

        protected final java.lang.String viewName
        the view to fetch data from

      • columnNames

        protected java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> columnNames
        the column names to fetch data from. Hardcoded to the class and not to the interface because it is very important for the columns to get iterated in the same order they would have been returned by a raw SQL query

      • columnNamesRaw

        protected final java.lang.String[] columnNamesRaw
        the raw column names to fetch data from, "raw" = as given by the user. E.g., "*" would equal "get all columns"

      • condition

        protected final java.lang.String condition
        the part of the query to send to the database after WHERE, e.g.
        "SELECT * FROM view_name WHERE amp_activity_in in (...) and (...) ORDER BY (...)" has the bold part = condition

      • logger

        protected static org.apache.log4j.Logger logger

      • getFetcherForView

        public static ViewFetcher getFetcherForView(java.lang.String viewName,
                                            java.lang.String condition,
                                            java.lang.String locale,
                                            java.util.Map<PropertyDescription,ColumnValuesCacher> cachers,
                                            java.sql.Connection connection,
                                            java.lang.String... columnNames)
        selects a fetcher for a view, depending on whether the view is configured to use i18n or not
        Parameters:
        viewName - - the view to fetch
        condition - - the condition to pass in raw form to SQL
        locale - - the locale. Ignored if it is a non-i18n-view
        cachers - - the cacher for the fetched i18n values. Ignored if it is a non-i18n-view
        connection - - the connection to run the SQL queries on
        columnNames - - the columns to fetch. "*" or "null" or "none" means all
        Returns:
